channel.title: XP Rate Discussion
channel.description:
After looking at the results from the poll for the first alpha, I'm pretty happy to see that the majority of people were okay with the XP rate we had, which was a simple 3x. Because there were a pretty large number of people that voted that it was a bit too slow, for the next alpha I'm going to try out 6x. I'm expecting that this will be too fast, but it'll be good to see what people think and work from there, maybe come up with a middle ground like 4.5 or something.
You can use this topic to discuss your thoughts from the last alpha, but most of the real discussion will be after the next one.

item.title: XP Rate Discussion
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:63, topic:549498”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=668400.msg4473375#msg4473375 date=1424391378]
i’d play a server like that for maybe a few hours, and then never log in again…
[/quote]what type of server[/quote]

[quote=“Tatemo, post:57, topic:549498”]I am a firm believer that Deltascape was the beginning of the end for private servers. Do you know why? Because it took too long to level up. The beauty of Allstar, Reaper Scape, White whatever the fudge it was called etc was that they took the most enjoyable elements of Runescape and threw out all the boring stuff.

Honestly, the kind of person who thinks it is fun to run from the Yews in Varrock castle back to the grand exchange 1,000,000 times is someone who needs to visit a doctor. Just go outside, get a job, get a mortgage and play that game.

High exp rate, ridiculous drop rates, retardedly rare super powered items, everything is OP. Potions give you +300 strength when you have 99 herblore. Strength bonuses in the 1000s are commonplace. Items can buff health. Maximum health is more like 10000 and you have to grind the shit out of it to get there. Server resets, account losses, dupes, hacks, bannings etc all don’t matter because start a new account and in 20 minutes you are ready to PK again.

If you don’t like this, why don’t you just play old school RS? If you want to walk everywhere to do quests just play old school RS. Focus on the content, the quests, the combat mechanics. But keep the fun.

tl;dr ridiculous = fun. People were attracted to this community because it provided the fun bits of Runescape without the painful grind and ridiculous commitment levels. Give Runescape back to the casual player.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: XP Rate Discussion
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:60, topic:549498”][quote author=Tatemo link=topic=668400.msg4472328#msg4472328 date=1423818655]
And that’s what almost everyone else is doing too. Some incredibly well. Why do we need another one? Why not make something genuinely unique? Or, rather than starting again, yet again, why don’t we pitch our efforts towards a currently successful server and improve that?
[/quote]That’s not what most servers are doing, not even close to most. Currently most servers are old graphics (317-474) servers with crazy new custom items where you can (sometimes) pay to win, modern servers (600+), or even some EOC servers. In fact I would implore you to find more than one popular server based in 500’s era, or a server that has successfully done what we are trying to do.

And you’re a bit late to the party my friend, this server has been under development for over a year now :P[/quote]

Only a year? I thought the Moparscape server was in development when I left! Hahahaha.

Well, I have had a further look Davidi and I must concede what you guys have done is pretty sick. I’m still definitely a firm believer in the mental side of RSPS though. I might go and look for some of them. Good luck with this.

Read full topic

Or, rather than starting again, yet again, why don’t we pitch our efforts towards a currently successful server and improve that?[/quote]That’s not what most servers are doing, not even close to most. Currently most servers are old graphics (317-474) servers with crazy new custom items where you can (sometimes) pay to win, modern servers (600+), or even some EOC servers. In fact I would implore you to find more than one popular server based in 500’s era, or a server that has successfully done what we are trying to do.

And you’re a bit late to the party my friend, this server has been under development for over a year now

Read full topic

item.title: XP Rate Discussion
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Davidi2:

That is definitely one way to run a server Tatemo, and it works in some cases and appeals to a certain portion of the playerbase. I myself hosted one of those servers back when I first started. However, not everyone agrees that remakes are not fun to play. It’s not black and white (replica vs ridiculous), there is a middle ground, which is what we’re striving for. We plan to have the core game be the same, but also speed up the grind aspect of the game and add our own content.

And that’s what almost everyone else is doing too. Some incredibly well. Why do we need another one? Why not make something genuinely unique? Or, rather than starting again, yet again, why don’t we pitch our efforts towards a currently successful server and improve that?

Read full topic

item.title: XP Rate Discussion
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

I am a firm believer that Deltascape was the beginning of the end for private servers. Do you know why? Because it took too long to level up. The beauty of Allstar, Reaper Scape, White whatever the fuck it was called etc was that they took the most enjoyable elements of Runescape and threw out all the boring stuff.

Honestly, the kind of person who thinks it is fun to run from the Yews in Varrock castle back to the grand exchange 1,000,000 times is someone who needs to visit a doctor. Just go outside, get a job, get a mortgage and play that game.

High exp rate, ridiculous drop rates, retardedly rare super powered items, everything is OP. Potions give you +300 strength when you have 99 herblore. Strength bonuses in the 1000s are commonplace. Items can buff health. Maximum health is more like 10000 and you have to grind the shit out of it to get there. Server resets, account losses, dupes, hacks, bannings etc all don’t matter because start a new account and in 20 minutes you are ready to PK again.

If you don’t like this, why don’t you just play old school RS? If you want to walk everywhere to do quests just play old school RS. Focus on the content, the quests, the combat mechanics. But keep the fun.

tl;dr ridiculous = fun. People were attracted to this community because it provided the fun bits of Runescape without the painful grind and ridiculous commitment levels. Give Runescape back to the casual player.

Read full topic

item.title: XP Rate Discussion
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“stCky, post:54, topic:549498”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=668400.msg4471559#msg4471559 date=1423286002]
Like I said, the whole “choose your xp” isn’t going to happen.
[/quote]
You haven’t actually said why though, no “discussion” just “no”[/quote]Because it’s such a bad idea that I didn’t even want to waste my time writing up a response for it. I’ll give some quick points:

  1. Completely removes competitive aspect of the game, which may completely alienate people who choose lower XP rates because they feel like their time is wasted
  2. Economy is completely unfair as people who get to higher levels faster can get high level materials/items so much sooner

Sure you could write code to give people with lower xp rates various bonuses or somehow hinder people with higher xp rates, but if you are doing that then what was the point of the different rates in the first place?

“Choose your own XP rate” pretty much translates to “single player RS”, and if people want that they can host the source locally.

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:55, topic:549498”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=668400.msg4472295#msg4472295 date=1423801308]
I really want to make an executive choice and just implement either a custom or scaling XP rate. The point of this server is to emulate a real game experience, not just let people play their endgame fantasies. The depth of the experience is characterized too by what happens in the early levels.
[/quote]

Which goes back to my suggestion on having the exp rate be based on the slayer skill. 1-10 = 1x Exp, 11-20 = 2x. But possibly keep the slayer skill a constant exp rate?[/quote]I don’t really like that at all. A lot of people dislike slayer or will want to be “skillers”, and it doesn’t seem like a good idea to force anyone to train any skill.

Like sinisoul said, it’s pretty much been decided that the XP rate will be a flat bonus rate or one that scales to make the higher levels be not quite as grindy.

Read full topic

item.title: XP Rate Discussion
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

sinisoul:

I really want to make an executive choice and just implement either a custom or scaling XP rate. The point of this server is to emulate a real game experience, not just let people play their endgame fantasies. The depth of the experience is characterized too by what happens in the early levels.

Which goes back to my suggestion on having the exp rate be based on the slayer skill. 1-10 = 1x Exp, 11-20 = 2x. But possibly keep the slayer skill a constant exp rate?

Read full topic

item.title: XP Rate Discussion
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

If people want to reach level 99s quickly but you want things like fishing to continue then why not incentivise 200m experience? That’s another approach to consider.

As for my previous post, you could apply the mechanism to the production of primary goods (e.g., ores, bars, etc) and not the production of final products (such as platemail). Mining contest occurs? After a certain point, prioritise the lower level players when it comes to getting ores from rocks, logs from trees, whatever.

I know it’s hard work though, all said and done.

Read full topic

item.title: XP Rate Discussion
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

99 fishing in the first 3 months? Sorry but at 5x+ the rate this could be achieved in less than a few days. Maybe instead of having a higher exp rate just do 2x skilling related events? For example if I fish lobster, I should get 2 rather than 1…

I don’t think people go on private servers to play for 72 straight hours. Sure skilling is fun but saying that 99 can be achieved in “under a few days” is an extreme exaggeration for most of the community.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: XP Rate Discussion
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

Well, the idea behind that would be players would see value in fishing meaning more fish would be introduced. If 10 people get 99 fishing within the first 3 months, the market would be able to support that. But not 10 people are going to get 99, probably around 30-50 would have 60+ fishing at that point meaning lobbys and shark would mellow out.

Economies fix themselves and fudge themselves, as long as you allow it to. When people try to ‘fix’ it, is when it becomes unstable.

Read full topic

(Barrows, Bosses, Pking, Training) Then I would be forced to obtain millions of fishing exp just to have enough food to suffice.[/quote]Yup, either that or fish will have exorbitant pricing.

item.title: XP Rate Discussion
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:41, topic:549498”]So make those low level items worth pursuing in their own right? Why not make the experience given for creating a potion the function of your current level instead of some arbitrary value? Suddenly creating all potions is worth your time.
Same goes with farming.

Maybe you only do it for select items, or maybe you do it across the board. The important thing though is that there are ways to keep content relevant and available.[/quote]That’s what I mean though, that’s how the RS economy works. At a certain point some items are just strictly not worth producing. For example you aren’t going to keep making iron items past level 30 or whatever smithing, unless you specifically need iron arrows. That’s how RS is designed. But if you get a too high XP rate there may not be enough iron in the economy for people to buy iron to train smithing (if thats how they want to do it), or whatever you want to consider. It’s more complex than that obviously, and it’s not about items becoming obsolete (thats a different issue), it just messes with the supply/demand.

Read full topic

item.title: XP Rate Discussion
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

So make those low level items worth pursuing in their own right? Why not make the experience given for creating a potion the function of your current level instead of some arbitrary value? Suddenly creating all potions is worth your time.
Same goes with farming.

Maybe you only do it for select items, or maybe you do it across the board. The important thing though is that there are ways to keep content relevant and available.

Read full topic

item.title: XP Rate Discussion
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

At better XP rates, things would be completed quicker meaning more items introduced.

I’m a firm believer of 5x-8x aswell but I don’t agree a drop rate should be introduced any higher than usual. Of course, drop rates are also constantly changing depending on item availability and whether or not it needs to be tweaked too.

Read full topic
